data.prayer: Jesus, please send your Spirit to Yukhari-Karabakh, so they can have freedom.
data.verse: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is freedom.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Yukhari-Karabakh, Azerbaijan
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Father, it’s possible most of the 296,921 lost people in  Yukhari-Karabakh, Azerbaijan have never held or opened a Bible. Please change this, Father.
data.verse: Yet faith comes from listening to this Good News—the Good News about Christ.

data.prayer: Father, we pray that the people of Yukhari-Karabakh, Azerbaijan will learn to study the Bible, understand it, obey it, and share it.
Spirit, guide someone in the church in the state of Yukhari-Karabakh to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

data.prayer: Father, 0.0% are known to be believers. Please, Lord call more today.
Jesus, defend your people in the state of Yukhari-Karabakh against the difficulty of these last days.
data.verse: But mark this: There will be terrible times in the last days. 2 People will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy, 3 without love, unforgiving, slanderous, without self-control, brutal, not lovers of the good, 4 treacherous, rash, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God— 5 having a form of godliness but denying its power.

data.prayer: Good Shepherd, thank you that you know the name of each of the 799 believers in Yukhari-Karabakh.
data.verse: I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me

data.prayer: Jesus, help the local leaders in Yukhari-Karabakh, Azerbaijan not be proud but humble, and willing to wash the feet of all they serve.
data.verse: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am. Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.
